AIX Commands for dealing with Full File Systems

  1. When you get the notification on a file system approaching the upper limits do the following steps. Be sure to open a log document, Notepad, Wordpad or Word to keep track of your steps and results.
  2. Do a df -g on the suspect file system. This will capture the initial state. 
     df -g {file system}
  3. Change direcory to the offending file system 
     cd [file system}
  4. List the files in most recient order of access 
     ls -liat | more
  5. Check for the user writing to the file displayed above 
     fuser -fu {file name}
  6. Use the find command to locate large files in the file system/directory to see if they canbe cleaned up. 
     find . -depth -size 10000c -exec ls -l {} \;
  7. Another tool is the List Open Files tool lsof. There are several excellent options to assist in determining the process id (pid) and user that is writing to the file.
     lsof +d {file system}
    lsof +D {file system}
     lsof +d {file system}
    lsof +d {file system} +r
